intro: Spatalla pedunculata, commonly known as the clustered spurge, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa and the Middle East. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family, which includes many species with milky sap. The plant typically grows as a shrub or herb, featuring small, green leaves and yellowish flowers that are clustered in umbels. Its latex is toxic and can cause skin irritation, making it a plant to handle with care. Spatalla pedunculata is often found in arid or semi-arid environments, thriving in well-drained soils.
